revised_title: Quantitative Analysis of Food Chain Lengths in Community Food Webs
tldr: This study presents a quantitative theory of food chain lengths using the cascade model and tests it against data from real food webs. The model describes the frequency distribution of chain lengths in most of the 62 webs previously used to develop and test the model, as well as 51 new webs. The species-link scaling law, a central feature of the cascade model, is not contradicted by the new data.
